Authors: R. H. Petersen, K. W. Hughes, Juan L. Mata
Title: The genus Lentinula in the Americas.
Abstract:
Recent studies have reported only Lentinula boryana and L.
guarapiensis from the American continent, the latter known only from its
type specimen. We report at least three extant species. Two widely
distributed species, L. boryana and L. raphanica comb. nov., are
discussed in this paper, and a new species is being described elsewhere.
The geographic ranges of both species apparently overlap throughout
tropical and subtropical America except for the Gulf Coast region of the
United States, from which only L. raphanica can be reported. Lentinula
boryana and L. raphanica differ in basidiome micromorphology, especially
cheilocystidial form, spore dimensions, sexual compatibility profiles,
and ITS sequences.
